title: Git and GitHub Knowledge Quiz
instructions: Select the best answer for each question.

questions.question: Which command creates a new local repository?
questions.explanation: git init initializes a new Git repository in the current directory.

questions.question: Which command shows the commit history?
questions.explanation: git log displays the commit history for the current branch.

questions.question: What does git commit -m "message" do?
options: Creates a commit with the message "message"
Adds all files and commits with message
Pushes commit with message to remote
Creates a new branch with message
questions.explanation: git commit -m creates a new commit with the specified commit message.

questions.question: What is a pull request?
options: A request to pull changes from remote
A mechanism to propose and review changes
questions.explanation: A pull request is a mechanism to propose changes and request review before merging.

questions.question: You made changes but forgot to create a new branch. What should you do?
options: Delete all changes and start over
git stash; git checkout -b new-branch; git stash pop
questions.explanation: Use git stash to save changes, create and checkout new branch, then git stash pop to apply changes.
